intro: Walwhalleya subxerophila, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions by accessing water from deeper soil layers. It is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation, making it a typical example of xerophytic vegetation. Walwhalleya subxerophila plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
